intro: Uragoga domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican orchid, is a rare and specialized plant native to the tropical regions of the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and vibrant coloration. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often on tree trunks or rocky surfaces. Its flowers are usually fragrant and attract specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Uragoga domingensis is considered a vulnerable species.
